00001 /*
00002 
00003 Header for PLY polygon files.
00004 
00005 - Greg Turk, March 1994
00006 
00007 A PLY file contains a single polygonal _object_.
00008 
00009 An object is composed of lists of _elements_.  Typical elements are
00010 vertices, faces, edges and materials.
00011 
00012 Each type of element for a given object has one or more _properties_
00013 associated with the element type.  For instance, a vertex element may
00014 have as properties three floating-point values x,y,z and three unsigned
00015 chars for red, green and blue.
00016 
00017 ---------------------------------------------------------------
00018 
00019 Copyright (c) 1994 The Board of Trustees of The Leland Stanford
00020 Junior University.  All rights reserved.   
00021   
00022 Permission to use, copy, modify and distribute this software and its   
00023 documentation for any purpose is hereby granted without fee, provided   
00024 that the above copyright notice and this permission notice appear in   
00025 all copies of this software and that you do not sell the software.   
00026   
00027 THE SOFTWARE IS PROVIDED "AS IS" AND WITHOUT WARRANTY OF ANY KIND,   
00028 EXPRESS, IMPLIED OR OTHERWISE, INCLUDING WITHOUT LIMITATION, ANY   
00029 WARRANTY OF MERCHANTABILITY OR FITNESS FOR A PARTICULAR PURPOSE.   
00030 
00031 */
00032 
00033 #ifndef __PLY_H__
00034 #define __PLY_H__
00035 
00036 #define LITTLE_ENDIAN // Force little-endiannes (default architecture for Win & Linux)
00037 
00038 #ifdef __cplusplus
00039 extern "C" {
00040 #endif

00042 #include <stdio.h>
00043 #include <stddef.h>
00044 
00045 #define PLY_ASCII      1        /* ascii PLY file */
00046 #define PLY_BINARY_BE  2        /* binary PLY file, big endian */
00047 #define PLY_BINARY_LE  3        /* binary PLY file, little endian */
00048 
00049 #define PLY_OKAY    0           /* ply routine worked okay */
00050 #define PLY_ERROR  -1           /* error in ply routine */
00051 
00052 /* scalar data types supported by PLY format */
00053 
00054 #define PLY_START_TYPE 0
00055 #define PLY_CHAR       1
00056 #define PLY_SHORT      2
00057 #define PLY_INT        3
00058 #define PLY_UCHAR      4
00059 #define PLY_USHORT     5
00060 #define PLY_UINT       6
00061 #define PLY_FLOAT      7
00062 #define PLY_DOUBLE     8
00063 #define PLY_FLOAT32    9
00064 #define PLY_UINT8      10
00065 #define PLY_INT32      11
00066 #define PLY_END_TYPE   12
00067 
00068 #define  PLY_SCALAR  0
00069 #define  PLY_LIST    1
00070 
00071         namespace omega { class DataStream; };
00072 
00073 
00074 typedef struct PlyProperty {    /* description of a property */
00075 
00076   const char *name;                     /* property name */
00077   int external_type;                    /* file's data type */
00078   int internal_type;                    /* program's data type */
00079   int offset;                           /* offset bytes of prop in a struct */
00080 
00081   int is_list;                          /* 1 = list, 0 = scalar */
00082   int count_external;                   /* file's count type */
00083   int count_internal;                   /* program's count type */
00084   int count_offset;                     /* offset byte for list count */
00085 
00086 } PlyProperty;
00087 
00088 typedef struct PlyElement {     /* description of an element */
00089   char *name;                   /* element name */
00090   int num;                      /* number of elements in this object */
00091   int size;                     /* size of element (bytes) or -1 if variable */
00092   int nprops;                   /* number of properties for this element */
00093   PlyProperty **props;          /* list of properties in the file */
00094   char *store_prop;             /* flags: property wanted by user? */
00095   int other_offset;             /* offset to un-asked-for props, or -1 if none*/
00096   int other_size;               /* size of other_props structure */
00097 } PlyElement;
00098 
00099 typedef struct PlyOtherProp {   /* describes other properties in an element */
00100   char *name;                   /* element name */
00101   int size;                     /* size of other_props */
00102   int nprops;                   /* number of properties in other_props */
00103   PlyProperty **props;          /* list of properties in other_props */
00104 } PlyOtherProp;
00105 
00106 typedef struct OtherData { /* for storing other_props for an other element */
00107   void *other_props;
00108 } OtherData;
00109 
00110 typedef struct OtherElem {     /* data for one "other" element */
00111   char *elem_name;             /* names of other elements */
00112   int elem_count;              /* count of instances of each element */
00113   OtherData **other_data;      /* actual property data for the elements */
00114   PlyOtherProp *other_props;   /* description of the property data */
00115 } OtherElem;
00116 
00117 typedef struct PlyOtherElems {  /* "other" elements, not interpreted by user */
00118   int num_elems;                /* number of other elements */
00119   OtherElem *other_list;        /* list of data for other elements */
00120 } PlyOtherElems;
00121 
00122 typedef struct PlyFile {        /* description of PLY file */
00123   omega::DataStream* stream;
00124   FILE *fp;                     /* file pointer */
00125   int file_type;                /* ascii or binary */
00126   float version;                /* version number of file */
00127   int nelems;                   /* number of elements of object */
00128   PlyElement **elems;           /* list of elements */
00129   int num_comments;             /* number of comments */
00130   char **comments;              /* list of comments */
00131   int num_obj_info;             /* number of items of object information */
00132   char **obj_info;              /* list of object info items */
00133   PlyElement *which_elem;       /* which element we're currently writing */
00134   PlyOtherElems *other_elems;   /* "other" elements from a PLY file */
00135 } PlyFile;
